maml:description.maml:para: Get memory information from performance counters
Use this command to simplify the process of getting data from memory related performance counters.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to a CimSession.
Enter the name of a computer to connect to.
Connect to a CimSession.
Enter the name of a computer to connect to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryPerformance
AvailableBytes : 17207111680 AvailableKBytes : 16803820 AvailableMBytes : 16409 CacheBytes : 374910976 CacheBytesPeak : 627560448 CacheFaultsPersec : 6419 CommitLimit : 39345614848 CommittedBytes : 21974437888 DemandZeroFaultsPersec : 741 FreeAndZeroPageListBytes : 696127488 FreeSystemPageTableEntries : 12267190 LongTermAverageStandbyCacheLifetimes : 14400 ModifiedPageListBytes : 24715264 PageFaultsPersec : 7204 PageReadsPersec : 0 PagesInputPersec : 0 PagesOutputPersec : 0 PagesPersec : 0 PageWritesPersec : 0 PercentCommittedBytesInUse : 55 PoolNonpagedAllocs : 1182049 PoolNonpagedBytes : 559136768 PoolPagedAllocs : 1398128 PoolPagedBytes : 831823872 PoolPagedResidentBytes : 741318656 StandbyCacheCoreBytes : 155684864 StandbyCacheNormalPriorityBytes : 9012703232 StandbyCacheReserveBytes : 7342587904 SystemCacheResidentBytes : 374902784 SystemCodeResidentBytes : 0 SystemCodeTotalBytes : 0 SystemDriverResidentBytes : 12992512 SystemDriverTotalBytes : 29093888 TransitionFaultsPersec : 83 TransitionPagesRePurposedPersec : 0 WriteCopiesPersec : 0 DateTime : 11/21/2018 12:17:16 PM ComputerName : BOVINE320

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all memory counters for the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryPerformance -Computername $c | Select Computername,%CommittedBytes*,AvailableMBytes,CacheBytes
Computername %CommittedBytesInUse AvailableMbytes CacheBytes ------------ -------------------- --------------- ---------- CHI-HVR1 7.05788756820636 14839 99377152 CHI-HVR2 16.8986961377323 13144 83001344 CHI-P50 24.753204334977 47143 94998528 CHI-DC04 47.8621563768474 1030 180101120 Win10-ENT-01 79.914213523203 1545 96137216

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get selected performance data from multiple computers defined in variable c.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a snapshot of memory usage.
This command will write a custom memory utilization object to the pipeline that indicates the current memory state.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect using an existing CIMSession
Filter on a given status.
Specify the name of the computer or computers to query.
Filter on a given status.
Connect using an existing CIMSession
Specify the name of the computer or computers to query.
Filter on a given status.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryUsage -computername chi-p50
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- CHI-P50 OK 71.99 45.98 64

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryUsage dom1,srv1,srv2,win10 -Status Warning
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- WIN10 Warning 36.57 1.17 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get usage from several computers but filter and only display those with a Warning.

maml:description.maml:para: This command will query the Win32_PhysicalMemory class to get hardware details about installed memory.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect via an existing CimSession.
Specify the name of a computer or computers to query.
Connect via an existing CimSession.
Specify the name of a computer or computers to query.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PhysicalMemory
Computername : BOVINE320 Manufacturer : Kingston CapacityGB : 16 Form : SODIMM ClockSpeed : 2400 Voltage : 1200 DeviceLocator : ChannelA-DIMM0
Computername : BOVINE320 Manufacturer : Kingston CapacityGB : 16 Form : SODIMM ClockSpeed : 2400 Voltage : 1200 DeviceLocator : ChannelB-DIMM0

maml:description.maml:para: Display processes using the most memory.

This command will use Get-CimInstance to retrieve the top processes by Workingset. It will retrieve the top 5 by default. The output will include a percentage of total in-use memory the process is using as well as the process owner.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect via an existing CimSession.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.
Connect via an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-TopProcessMemory -Computername chi-p50
Computername : chi-p50 ProcessID : 3128 Name : dns.exe WS(MB) : 450.78125 PctUsed : 2.28 CreationDate : 5/21/2018 10:50:39 AM RunTime : 17.00:21:09.9646185 Commandline : C:\WINDOWS\system32\dns.exe Owner : NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE
Computername : chi-p50 ProcessID : 3104 Name : MsMpEng.exe WS(MB) : 137.33984375 PctUsed : 0.69 CreationDate : 5/21/2018 10:50:39 AM RunTime : 17.00:21:10.0191119 Commandline : Owner : NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE
Computername : chi-p50 ProcessID : 7180 Name : ServerManager.exe WS(MB) : 90.6328125 PctUsed : 0.46 CreationDate : 5/21/2018 10:51:07 AM RunTime : 17.00:20:42.2754743 Commandline : "C:\WINDOWS\system32\ServerManager.exe" Owner : NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE
Computername : chi-p50 ProcessID : 7568 Name : Lenovo.Modern.ImController.exe WS(MB) : 81.3359375 PctUsed : 0.41 CreationDate : 5/21/2018 11:03:01 AM RunTime : 17.00:08:47.9026653 Commandline : "C:\Program Files\Lenovo\ImController\Service\Lenovo.Modern.ImController.exe" Owner : NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE
Computername : chi-p50 ProcessID : 7980 Name : MicrosoftEdgeCP.exe WS(MB) : 78.5390625 PctUsed : 0.4 CreationDate : 5/22/2018 8:06:35 PM RunTime : 15.15:05:14.5392500 Commandline : "C:\Windows\SystemApps\Microsoft.MicrosoftEdge_8wekyb3d8bbwe\microsoftedgecp.exe" SCODEF:7004 REDAT:140564 /prefetch:2 Owner : NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE

maml:description.maml:para: Display a colorized version of memory usage.

This is a variation of the Get-MemoryUsage command. This version writes to the console using Write-Host and colorizes the output. Normal values will be displayed in green. Warnings will be displayed in yellow and Critical systems in red.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
Connect to an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.

dev:type.maml:name: None. This command writes to the console.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS S:\MemoryTools> show-memoryusage -Computername Dom1,Srv1,Srv2,Win10
**************** * Memory Check * ****************
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- DOM1 OK 99.92 1023.2 1024 SRV1 OK 99.96 1023.63 1024 SRV2 OK 99.95 1023.51 1024 WIN10 Warning 36.89 1.19 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: The line for Win10 would be displayed in Yellow. The other computers would be displayed in Green.

maml:description.maml:para: Test if a computer meets a specific memory threshhold.

This command can be used to test if memory utilization meets some criteria. There are several parameter sets for the different tests. All of them can be used with -Quiet to return a simple Boolean value.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to an existing CimSession.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum amount of used memory in GB
Connect to an existing CimSession.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum total memory in GB
Connect to an existing CimSession.
Enter the minimum free memory in GB.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Connect to an existing CimSession.
Enter the minimum % free memory
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the name of a computer or computers to test.
Enter the minimum % free memory
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the name of a computer or computers to test.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum amount of used memory in GB
Enter the name of a computer or computers to test.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum total memory in GB
Enter the name of a computer or computers to test.
Enter the minimum free memory in GB.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Connect to an existing CimSession.
Enter the name of a computer or computers to test.
Enter the minimum free memory in GB.
Enter the minimum % free memory
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum total memory in GB
Enter the minimum amount of used memory in GB

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> test-memoryusage
Computername PctFree Test ------------ ------- ---- BOVINE320 50.53 True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Run the default test on the local computer. The default percentage threshhold is 50%.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> test-memoryusage -FreeGB 16
Computername FreeGB Test ------------ ------ ---- BOVINE320 15.93 False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test if the computer has at least 16GB of free memory.
Test if the computer has at least 32GB of memory but only return True or False.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Test-MemoryUsage -UsedGB 20
Computername UsedGB Test ------------ ------ ---- BOVINE320 15.74 False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test if the computer is using at least 20GB of memory.
